She will be performing a dual role at the restaurant as bartender and beverage director. Most people know what a bartender does, but few understand the job of beverage director, which is ‚Äúall about the numbers to give guests the best value,‚Äù explains Shelby. ‚ÄúI am responsible for knowing my inventory, placing orders for highest quality product, knowing my vendors, invoicing and observing what moves off the shelf.‚Äù More importantly to the thirsty and sophisticated clientele, tending bar requires her to know how to stir, blend, shake and pour every drink out there, including the latest beverage trends and how to refine drinks to suit a customer‚Äôs preferences. A URI graduate, Shelby was born and raised in North Kingstown where she hails from a family of fishermen. She may be the only beverage director with a boat named after her. What are the drinks that are trending these days? ‚ÄúVintage cocktails are back, like Champagne cocktails and Sidecars, but I tweak them to create something more contemporary. Every city I visit has its own drinking style. Providence is funky and enjoys trying something new.‚Äù What makes a great mixologist? ‚ÄúKnowing what you have to work with, what the trends are and constantly developing new drink ideas. And get to know your guests. Do they prefer sweet, floral or savory? Be able to suggest something new that they might enjoy. For example, I like to contrast flavors, pairing a salty dish with a slightly sweet drink.‚Äù What is your favorite summer drink? ‚ÄúClean, crisp cocktails. Something like a ‚Äòspritzer plus,‚Äô not sweet like a pi√±a colada, but fun and¬†fresh; maybe a margarita with fresh squeezed limes and a touch of jalape√±o.‚Äù Save Save Facebook 0 Twitter 0 Pinterest 0 Post navigation Previous post Mill‚Äôs Tavern‚Äôs Secret Garden Next post Sous Chef, Ashleigh Blais prepares Braised Little Necks on the Rhode Show! coordinating and executing special events; and engaging her passion for wine with the curation of Mill‚Äôs wine list, which has earned the Wine Spectator Award of Excellence annually since 2014. ‚ÄúWe are so pleased to announce Kate‚Äôs promotion,‚Äù said Jim Brosseau, Director of Restaurant Operations, Encore Hospitality Group. ‚ÄúShe has been an invaluable member of our team for nearly four years, demonstrating an incredible dedication to our wine program, special events, and, most importantly, guest satisfaction, and we look forward to her continued growth and impact on the restaurant.‚Äù Prior to joining Mill‚Äôs Tavern, Kate was the Sales Manager at Sage Cellars in Warren, overseeing the sales team, assisting with marketing and vendor relations, and maintaining a portfolio of key accounts.¬† She also served as Food & Beverage Director at the Carnegie Abbey Club in Portsmouth, and was Assistant General Manager and Banquet Manager at DeWolf Tavern in Bristol for seven years, overseeing the day-to-day operations, marketing and advertising, and special events. Two Providence restaurants ‚Äì Mill‚Äôs Tavern & Red Stripe ‚Äì win culinary awards July 3, 2024 / Nancy Thomas Mill‚Äôs Tavern Secures EatDrinkRI Award at Taste of RI Mill‚Äôs Tavern at 101 North Main Street in Providence, and provider‚Äôs of RINewsToday‚Äôs weekly We Cook! recipe feature, announces it was awarded the prestigious EatDrinkRI award at the recent Taste of RI in Warwick . Presented by Dave Dadekian, founder of EatDrinkRI , well-known figure in Rhode Island‚Äôs culinary scene, this award highlights Mill‚Äôs Tavern‚Äôs for exceptional contributions to the local hospitality industry. The Taste of RI is a popular showcase of the state‚Äôs finest in culinary talents, featuring over 40 vendors. Mill‚Äôs Tavern stood out for its innovative use of local and seasonal ingredients, crafted by Executive Chef Ed Bolus. This recognition from EatDrinkRI underscores the restaurant‚Äôs commitment to providing a remarkable dining experience. ‚ÄúWe are honored to receive the EatDrinkRI award at the Taste of RI,‚Äù said Executive Chef Ed Bolus , Mill‚Äôs Tavern. ‚ÄúThis recognition is a testament to the hard work and dedication of our entire team. We strive to create dishes that not only highlight the incredible local ingredients available to us but also provide a memorable dining experience for our guests.‚Äù About Mill‚Äôs Tavern: For years, this Rhode Island favorite has provided guests with an exceptional dining experience. Whether for a romantic evening, special celebration or business dinner, Mill‚Äôs Tavern offers that perfect match: fine dining in a unique urban setting at the foot of historic College Hill. Chef Edward Bolus delivers an impressive menu that combines local and seasonal ingredients in innovative and exciting new ways. The fruits and vegetables are harvested from area farms. The chops and steaks are cut daily, and the seafood is always fresh. Chef Bolus‚Äô knowledge and skills coupled with a passion for improvisation guarantees¬†a noteworthy dining experience. Located in the century-old Pilgrim Mill‚Äôs Building in Providence, the Mill‚Äôs Tavern dining room has rustic brick walls, polished dark woods, vaulted casement ceilings and linen tablecloths that work together to impart a sophisticated yet cozy ambiance. A wood-burning oven‚Äîused in much of the cooking‚Äìglows cheerily from an open kitchen, where the bustle of busy chefs and food servers lends an energetic vibe. The sleekly designed and fully stocked bar serves a wide array of cocktails and beers, and also offers the opportunity for casual dining. Additionally, Mills Tavern is known for its extensive and award-winning wine selection and has been the recipient of Wine Spectator magazine‚Äôs ‚ÄúAward of Excellence‚Äù annually since 2014.¬† This Providence destination restaurant has tables that can be reserved for small private functions or special celebrations. Whether enjoying a glass of wine and fresh oysters at the bar or a multi-course dinner in the elegantly appointed dining room, Mill‚Äôs Tavern serves up a delightful experience.¬† For more information, visit www.millstavernrestaurant.com . ___ Red Stripe wins People‚Äôs Choice Award in 11 th Annual RI Food Fights‚Äô ‚ÄúBig BURGER Blowout 2024‚Äù Red Stripe , located at 465 Angell Street in Providence, won the coveted People‚Äôs Choice Award in RI Food Fights‚Äô ‚ÄúBig BURGER Blowout 2024‚Äù The ‚ÄúBig BURGER Blowout‚Äù is a month-long celebration that features numerous restaurants across Rhode Island competing to create the best burger. This year saw a record number of participating restaurants and Food Fighters‚Äîenthusiasts who sample and vote on the offerings‚Äîmaking Red Stripe‚Äôs win particularly significant. ‚ÄúWe are incredibly honored to receive the People‚Äôs Choice Award,‚Äù said Joe Peticca, Sous Chef at Red Stripe . ‚ÄúOur team has dedicated themselves to crafting a burger that not only meets but exceeds our guests‚Äô expectations. This award is a testament to their hard work and the support of our patrons.‚Äù Peticca was also a featured chef in RINewsToday‚Äôs We Cook! weekly recipe feature Established in 2005, Red Stripe has built a reputation as an ‚ÄòAmerican brasserie‚Äô known for serving creatively refined comfort food with an upscale French influence. This latest accolade underscores the restaurant‚Äôs dedication to delivering high-quality, memorable dining experiences. For more information about Red Stripe, or to make a reservation, call 401-437-6950 or visit www.RedStripeRestaurants.com . About Red Stripe Restaurant: Red Stripe restaurant serves creatively refined comfort food with an upscale French influence. Everything on the menu is made from scratch using fresh, high-quality ingredients. Some of Red Stripe‚Äôs most popular menu items are the 10-ounce hangar steak served with signature frites; Portuguese mussels with chorizo, cherry tomatoes, and white wine; grilled cheese with prosciutto, poached pear, and pesto; and juicy, hand-packed burgers. Red Stripe is located at 465 Angell Street in Wayland Square on the East Side of Providence.¬† The restaurant features a 1,650 sq. ft. private dining room, bar, and 70+ seat function space, and accommodates a total of 170 diners. For more information, visit www.redstriperestaurants.com . Sign up HERE for RINewsToday‚Äôs daily newsletter (and regular recipe feature, We Cook!) Friendly, cool ownership and staff, consistent events, active Discord channels, and great food and drinks. Eric E Frequently Asked Questions Is there a time / table limit? Friday-Sunday (and any time we are at/near capacity) we have a 90 minute time/table limit for the cafe and bar area. No reservation is required to come to our cafe and play games from our shelf. You will need a reservation for a private room, which can be made at this link within 1 hour of an open reservation slot. Is there an age limit at Tavern of Tales? No However, any person under 18 years of age must be accompanied by an adult at all times. Can I bring my dog? Yes! We have a dog friendly outdoor patio. Your dog must be up to date on their vaccinations and rabies shots, and must be able to prove this if asked. We are unable to accomodate animals inside, so do keep the weather in mind. We are unable to provide water dishes, but can fill yours up if you bring your own! Service dogs that are trained to assist people with disabilities are permitted on licensed establishments. Please note emotional support animals and pets do not qualify as service animals. For more information, please visit this link . Unfortunately no dogs are allowed in the indoor space except for trained service dogs. The host may ask you what service your dog is trained to provide. Emotional support animals are not allowed indoors at Tavern of Tales. What types of ID do you accept? As per the City of Boston , the only forms of acceptable ID at any establishment serving or selling alcohol are as follows: A Massachusetts Driver‚Äôs License; A Massachusetts Liquor Identification Card; A Massachusetts Identification Card; A Passport Issued by the United States or a government that is officially recognized by the United States; A Passport Card for a Passport issued by the United States; and A Military Identification Card. Are reservations required? Reservations are not necessary, but we highly encourage groups to reserve rooms as a way to skip the waitlist and guarantee your spot during peak times. Visit https://www.tavernoftales.com/reservations to start your booking. For parties of 7 or more, contact info@tavernoftales.com to save your spot. Dress Code & Body Hygeine Policy We want every guest to enjoy a comfortable, welcoming experience. To ensure the comfort of all, we ask that guests follow a few simple guidelines regarding attire and personal hygiene: We are a casual dining establishment ‚Äî jeans, t-shirts, sneakers, and other relaxed attire are perfectly acceptable. We do ask that clothing be clean and presentable (no excessive rips, stains, or offensive graphics). For safety reasons, shirts and shoes are required at all times. To provide a pleasant atmosphere for all guests, we ask that visitors maintain reasonable personal hygiene. Excessive or unpleasant odors ‚Äî whether from clothing, poor hygiene, or strong fragrances ‚Äî may disrupt the dining experience for others. Freshly laundered clothing and use of deodorant are strongly encouraged. Please avoid wearing heavy perfumes, colognes, or sprays, as these may affect the comfort of nearby guests. Our goal is to create a welcoming environment for everyone. We ask that all attire and grooming reflect consideration for fellow diners.
